Doesn't JUnit do this already? At least if I run the tests with ant I 
get an output similar to:

Testcase: testDateIsActiveNullDate took 0,016 sec
Testcase: testDateIsActiveToday took 0,031 sec
Testcase: testDateIsActivePast took 0,047 sec
...

I'm not sure how much use this kind of micro-testing would be, though 
I'm sure you could set up your test cases to provide more valid data.

Regards,
Jim Cheesman




Nathan Coast wrote:

> Hi,
> 
> Is anyone doing performance testing with junit or a junit extension?  I've 
> looked at JUnitPerf and I don't think it has the functionality I need.  I'd like 
> to record the time taken to execute individual junit tests.  The idea is that it 
> should then be possible identify when code changes occurred that caused a 
> significant drop in performance.
> 
> thanks
> Nathan
